space_technology_careers.description: Aerospace Engineers design, develop, and test aircraft, spacecraft, and missiles. They work on the structural design, guidance, navigation, and control systems, as well as the overall mission design.
space_technology_careers.required_education: Bachelor's degree in Aerospace Engineering or related field
space_technology_careers.career_growth_outlook: Expected to grow by 6% over the next decade

space_technology_careers.description: Satellite Engineers are responsible for designing, building, and maintaining satellites. They work on various satellite components including communication systems, power supply, and data processing units.
space_technology_careers.required_education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related field
skills_needed: Ability to work in multidisciplinary teams
space_technology_careers.career_growth_outlook: Expected to grow by 8% over the next decade

recommended_colleges.college_name: Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology (IIST)

space_technology_careers.description: Space Scientists conduct research and analyze data related to celestial bodies, the atmosphere, and space phenomena. They work on missions to explore planets, stars, and other celestial objects.
space_technology_careers.required_education: PhD in Physics, Astronomy, or Space Science
skills_needed: Strong background in physics and mathematics
Experience in data analysis and simulation
Ability to write and publish scientific papers
space_technology_careers.career_growth_outlook: Expected to grow by 7% over the next decade

recommended_books.title: Astrophysics for People in a Hurry
recommended_books.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

space_technology_careers.description: Mission Specialists are responsible for specific aspects of space missions, such as scientific research, navigation, and communication. They work closely with engineers and scientists to ensure mission success.
space_technology_careers.required_education: Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Engineering, Science, etc.)
space_technology_careers.career_growth_outlook: Expected to grow by 5% over the next decade

recommended_books.title: Human Spaceflight: Mission Analysis and Design
recommended_books.author: Wendell Mendell

space_technology_careers.description: Astrobiologists study the possibility of life beyond Earth. They examine extreme environments on Earth to understand how life might exist on other planets and moons.
space_technology_careers.required_education: PhD in Biology, Biochemistry, or a related field
space_technology_careers.career_growth_outlook: Expected to grow by 9% over the next decade

recommended_books.title: The Living Cosmos: Our Search for Life in the Universe
recommended_books.author: Chris Impey
